reviews.review_msg: Prof. Shi is responsive, caring, and very patient. Though his course canvas pages had small errors (sometimes he forgot to change the settings left by course taught in previous terms), he is still quite chill and gave extensions as long as you have reasonable explanations.  Overall a very enjoyable experience with this 300-level course.

Overall a solid guy ! Just would have like dmore time on the final project as he moved the deadline back almost a week from when he initially promised ! Other than that the lectures were quite good, and made quite good attempts at simplifying otherwise hard concepts to understand.

Becky is the most caring and helpful prof I have ever had. She repeatedly asks you to come to her for help if you get stuck. She walks you through the solution. Even if you get stuck with coding problems she will personally find the error and fix it and send you fixed code. She *really* wants students to succeed. 6/10 for lecture clarity though.

Pros: Fair Grader -Genuinely tries to improve and seeks feedback Very good at practical/applied teaching. Want to learn about data analytics? Take her course! Good notes Cons: Hard final, but was curved so it was fine. Took a few classes to realize that the students didn't have a good fundamental math background. However, she adjusted.

During our first lecture, Aaron made the class sound fun and interactive however THIS WAS VERY DECEIVING. He is super nice but has no teaching skills and is all over the place during lectures. This is NOT an introductory course (need R Studio experience) and it will cause you lots of stress. He gave everyone a good mark but I felt I learnt nothing
